On 29 August 2013 17:31, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote:
>
>> the idea was to have multiple objective fn's related to what you wanted to
>> achieve, so if I want a walker then I might measure (1) ability to
>> achieve a standing position, (2) distance traversed in N seconds, (3)
>> energy expended. Measure all three separately, and then place the
>> genome in a 3D cube where each metric represents an axis in 3D space.
[...]
>
>
> Hello Colin,
>
> The idea you write about in the above paragraph is very similar to the MOLE algorithm Jean-> Baptiste Mouret, Hod Lipson, and I introduce in our paper The Evolutionary Origins of
> Modularity. Check out Figure 3:
>
> http://jeffclune.com/publications/2013-CluneEtAl-EvolutionaryOriginsModularity-RoyalSociety.pdf
>
> Does that seem like what you are talking about?

Yes! (sorry for the response delay).

Also I quite like that 8 pixel retina task. Simple enough to be fast
to evaluate as well as understand/explain, but difficult enough to be
challenging.



> PS. We also have a summary of some other MOLE work here: http://jeffclune.com/publications/MouretClune-MoleTwoPageAbstract.pdf

Thanks for the links. Is there further work in this area? (maybe I
need to go back through the last few months posts?)

Colin
